Coordinating Conjuctions.question: I packed my bag _______ my lunch for the day.
I like apples _______ oranges.
I brushed my teeth _______ washed my face before bed.
We brought towels _______ sunscreen to the beach.
My family has a dog _______ a cat at home.
It was sunny _______ a little windy at the beach.
I was hungry _______ there was no food left.
I wanted to swim _______ the pool was closed.
It looked warm outside _______ it was actually cold.
I tried to reach the cup _______ it was too high.
Would you like juice _______ water to drink?
We can go to the beach _______ the park today.
Should I wear sneakers _______ sandals?
You can read a book _______ use the tablet.
Do you want oatmeal _______ toast for breakfast?
It started to rain _______ I used an umbrella.
I was very tired _______ I went to bed early.
My shoes got wet _______ I went home to change them.
It was very hot _______ we stayed in the shade.
The sun was strong _______ I put on sunscreen.
She is small _______ very strong.
It was raining _______ we still had fun at the beach.
The puzzle looked easy _______ it took a long time.
He doesn't like vegetables _______ he ate all his cucumbers.
The line was long _______ it moved quickly.
I drank lots of water _______ I was very thirsty.
I wore my jacket _______ it was cold outside.
We went to the beach _______ it was a beautiful day.
I went to bed early _______ I had a big day tomorrow.
I helped with the dishes _______ my mom needed help.

Subordinating Conjunctions.question: What is the subordinating conjunction in this sentence?
Subordinating Conjunctions.paragraph: The person who turned on the music needs to make sure it isn't too loud.

Subordinating Conjunctions.question: What is the subordinating conjunction in this sentence?
Subordinating Conjunctions.paragraph: Before you go to the beach, make sure to put on sunscreen.

Subordinating Conjunctions.question: What is the subordinating conjunction in this sentence?
Subordinating Conjunctions.paragraph: We ran inside when it started to rain.

Subordinating Conjunctions.question: What is the subordinating conjunction in this sentence?
Subordinating Conjunctions.paragraph: I was hungry because I didn't eat breakfast.

Subordinating Conjunctions.question: What is the subordinating conjunction in this sentence?
Subordinating Conjunctions.paragraph: We can leave after you put on your shoes.

Subordinating Conjunctions.question: What is the subordinating conjunction in this sentence?
Subordinating Conjunctions.paragraph: Although she was tired, she finished her homework.

Subordinating Conjunctions.question: What is the subordinating conjunction in this sentence?
Subordinating Conjunctions.paragraph: Bring an umbrella if it looks like rain.

Subordinating Conjunctions.question: What is the subordinating conjunction in this sentence?
Subordinating Conjunctions.paragraph: While we were swimming, Mom made lunch.

Subordinating Conjunctions.question: What is the subordinating conjunction in this sentence?
Subordinating Conjunctions.paragraph: I will help you since you helped me yesterday.

Subordinating Conjunctions.question: What is the subordinating conjunction in this sentence?
Subordinating Conjunctions.paragraph: He fell asleep as soon as his head hit the pillow.

Subordinating Conjunctions.question: What is the subordinating conjunction in this sentence?
Subordinating Conjunctions.paragraph: Until the lifeguard says it's safe, stay out of the water.

Subordinating Conjunctions.question: What is the subordinating conjunction in this sentence?
Subordinating Conjunctions.paragraph: We kept building even though the waves kept washing it away.

Subordinating Conjunctions.question: What is the subordinating conjunction in this sentence?
Subordinating Conjunctions.paragraph: Brush your teeth before you go to bed.

Subordinating Conjunctions.question: What is the subordinating conjunction in this sentence?
Subordinating Conjunctions.paragraph: I love the beach because I can swim and play in the sand.

Subordinating Conjunctions.question: What is the subordinating conjunction in this sentence?
Subordinating Conjunctions.paragraph: When the sun comes out, we can go outside.

Subordinating Conjunctions.question: What is the subordinating conjunction in this sentence?
Subordinating Conjunctions.paragraph: You can play after you clean your room.

Subordinating Conjunctions.question: What is the subordinating conjunction in this sentence?
Subordinating Conjunctions.paragraph: Wear a jacket if you feel cold.

Subordinating Conjunctions.question: What is the subordinating conjunction in this sentence?
Subordinating Conjunctions.paragraph: While Dad cooked dinner, I read my book.

Subordinating Conjunctions.question: What is the subordinating conjunction in this sentence?
Subordinating Conjunctions.paragraph: I shared my toys because sharing is kind.

Subordinating Conjunctions.question: What is the subordinating conjunction in this sentence?
Subordinating Conjunctions.paragraph: Since it was sunny, we decided to go to the beach.

Subordinating Conjunctions.question: What is the subordinating conjunction in this sentence?
Subordinating Conjunctions.paragraph: Call Grandma before it gets too late.

Subordinating Conjunctions.question: What is the subordinating conjunction in this sentence?
Subordinating Conjunctions.paragraph: Stay close to me until we find a good spot.

Subordinating Conjunctions.question: What is the subordinating conjunction in this sentence?
Subordinating Conjunctions.paragraph: Although he doesn't like bell peppers, he ate them anyway.

Subordinating Conjunctions.question: What is the subordinating conjunction in this sentence?
Subordinating Conjunctions.paragraph: As soon as Mom said it was time to go, I ran to the car.

Subordinating Conjunctions.question: What is the subordinating conjunction in this sentence?
Subordinating Conjunctions.paragraph: The girl who found the seashell was very excited.
_____ you finish your lunch, you can have fruit.
I wore sunscreen _____ I didn't want to get burned.
_____ it was cloudy, we still went to the beach.
Stay here _____ I come back.
The boy _____ lives next door is my friend.
